body:
@colesbury for nn yes, but cudnn has:
* `alpha` and `beta` on cudnnConvolutionBackwardFilter
* `alphaParamDiff` and `betaParamDiff` on cudnnBatchNormalizationBackward
which control addition of gradients and should be set to 1 and 0 in pytorch cudnn (it is `scale` and 1 in cudnn.torch: https://github.com/soumith/cudnn.torch/blob/master/SpatialConvolution.lua#L265)
